intro: Ischurochloa stenostachya, commonly known as the narrow-stalked grass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of hair. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish flowers, which are adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils. It is often found in disturbed areas and is used for forage in some regions due to its drought tolerance. Its botanical features make it an important component of grassland ecosystems in its native habitat.
